noun.description: An external angle of a wall or building.
examples: smaller stations followed the same pattern; stone-built, with strongly accented quoins

noun.description: A wedge or expanding mechanical device used for locking a letterpress form into a chase.
A wedge for raising the level of a gun barrel or for keeping it from rolling.

verb.description: Provide (a wall) with quoins or corners.
examples: the white plaster walls quoined with red sandstone blocks

verb.description: Lock up (a form) with a quoin.

origin: Middle English: variant of coin, used earlier in the sense cornerstone and wedge.
